author: NetForce1
body: Ssh updates the terminal title when logging into another machine. It would be very helpful if powershell did the same upon Enter-PSSession, especially when working in multiple terminal tabs (each with a session to a different machine).

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov did you mean to reference a different issue?  You've created a circular reference :)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT I discovered that sometimes users don't look GitHub references and only read post messages then we get duplicate issues and PRs.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @NetForce1 do you have a proposal on what you would like the title to be?

comments.author: NetForce1
comments.body:
It should at least include the username and hostname of the machine you are logged in to. On Ubuntu the GNOME Terminal sets the prompt as the window title when using bash locally or via ssh. But when I launch Powershell, it shows the bash prompt from where I launched pwsh. 

On my machine the the prompt (and thus the terminal title) looks like: `username@hostname: /path/to/working/dir`

title: Update terminal title for remote sessions
